item.title: Removal Of Tree, 25th September
item.description:
A couple of months ago the tree was removed O/S 14 Hurst Springs – DA5 3JZ by council, the existing planter which is the way has not yet been used an caller would like to know if there are any plans to replace the tree or can she go ahead and make a request for a X Over estimate. Please can we call back to advise.

item.description:

item.title: Witnessed my neighbour flyp building waste into my new clear garden, 25th September
item.description:
I wanted to share my experience regarding a concerning issue I encountered at the property. I recently saw the owner of number 18 disposing of waste behind his shed into my new garden in number 16. When I approached him about it, he seemed to mistake me for an enforcement officer because of the way I asked my questions. During our conversation, he shared that the landlord of number 16 had some work done on their property about a year ago, and unfortunately, the workers had left behind a considerable amount of waste without getting a skip behind his shed allegedly. I found it disheartening, especially since the owner of number 18 has also accumulated some workmen building waste in his own garden while he has work done too. It seems they are both struggling with this issue, and he mentioned he had photos from that time. I encouraged him to report it to the council because I believe it’s important to address these matters for everyone's benefit. Other residents in my building have reached out to the landlord about this situation and are hoping for a swift resolution. It’s worth noting that many I been informed have experienced delays when it comes to landlords addressing these problems and often ignored. I recently moved in just two days ago and had intended to utilise the garden for exercise, but the fly-tipping has made it impossible to enjoy that space now. Truly sympathise with everyone involved and would like to kindly request that the waste, including the abandoned mattress by the side of house be removed. It would greatly improve the neighborhood's appearance and help prevent potential infestations as winter approaches. Thank you for your attention to this matter and hope for swift resolution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Ravenscourt Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish strewn across alleyway, 25th September
item.description:
This alleyway is constantly covered in litter and lately there have been broken bottles, bottle caps from alcoholic beverages and possibly remnants of drug use. This alleyway is very close to a children's centre which makes this all the more concerning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
